TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed ConnectionMode extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Represents the connection mode to be used by the client when connecting to the Azure Cosmos DB service.
Docs.remarks: Direct and Gateway connectivity modes are supported. Gateway is the default.

example.code: DocumentClient client = new DocumentClient(endpointUri, masterKey, new ConnectionPolicy { ConnectionMode = ConnectionMode.Direct });

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.Azure.Cosmos.ConnectionMode Direct = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Uses direct connectivity to connect to the data nodes in the Azure Cosmos DB service. Use gateway only to initialize and cache logical addresses and refresh on updates
Docs.remarks: Use Direct connectivity for best performance. Connections are made to the data nodes on Azure Cosmos DB's clusters on a range of port numbers either using HTTPS or TCP/SSL.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.Azure.Cosmos.ConnectionMode Gateway = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Use the Azure Cosmos DB gateway to route all requests to the Azure Cosmos DB service. The gateway proxies requests to the right data partition.
Docs.remarks: Use Gateway connectivity when within firewall settings do not allow Direct connectivity. All connections are made to the database account's endpoint through the standard HTTPS port (443).
